text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to explain that a commercial lease can assign fire-safety responsibilities to the tenant. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under Section 1.1 (Article 3 FSO), stating that the neighbouring company, as a leaseholder using the premises for their trade, is 'also a responsible person.' Furthermore, in Section 3.1, it notes that the neighbouring company has its own independent duty to carry out a fire risk assessment and take general fire precautions as a responsible person under Article 3 of the FSO. This directly covers the concept of assigning/sharing responsibilities via the lease/occupancy arrangement.", "criterion_id": "938b8ea8-338e-4b84-90ec-be0a7edc224e"}
